alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Garland; Hot Spring; Pike; Southeast Polk County Higher Elevations; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 7:35AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Clark, Pike, southwestern Garland, east central Polk, southern Montgomery and southwestern Hot Spring Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 735 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles east of Mount Ida to near Albert Pike Recreation Area. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro... Mount Ida... Glenwood... Amity... Caddo Valley... Norman... Daisy... Little Missouri Falls Recreatio... Daisy State Park... Crater Of Diamonds State Park... Narrows Dam... Meyers... Lofton... DeGray Lake State Park... Bard Springs Recreation Area... Albert Pike Recreation Area... Mimosa... Halfway... Delight... Friendship... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Garland; Hot Spring; Pike; Southeast Polk County Higher Elevations; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations
